collectors.title: Database
collectors.titleDetails: (23 total Queries, 23 of them unique across 1 Connection)

queries.sql: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>1. The “right of use” model of IFRS 16 does not have to be applied to leases that are short term <i>(i.e. a lease with a term of 12 months or less from the commencement date). </i></p>\r\n<p>Confirm that any leases for which this exemption has been claimed meet the qualifying criteria.</p>', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>2. The “right of use” model of IFRS 16 does not have to be applied to leases for which the underlying asset is of low value <i>(refer to IFRS 16 B3 -B8 for guidance).</i></p>\r\n<p>Confirm that any leases for which this exemption has been claimed meet the qualifying criteria.</p>\r\n<p><i>NB: the “low value” criteria is an absolute criteria, based on the underlying asset having a value, when new, of US$5,000 or less. Materiality <strong> <u> does not</u> </strong> come into the equation..</i></p>', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>3. Ensure that the assessment of the lease term has taken into account each of the following:</p> <ul> <li>The non-cancellable period of the lease;</li> <li>• Periods covered by an option to extend the lease if the lessee is reasonably certain to exercise that option; and</li> <li>Periods covered by an option to terminate the lease if the lessee is reasonably certain not to exercise that option.</li> </ul> <i>See IFRS 16.B37 - 40 for guidance.</i>', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>4. Ensure that if the lease term has been revised, this has only happened as a result of a change in the non-cancellable period of the lease.</p>', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>5. On initial measurement, the right of use asset shall be measured at cost. </p>\r\n<p>Ensure that this has been calculated appropriately.</p>\r\n<i>See IFRS 16.24 for guidance.</i>', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>6. Generally, the right of use asset will be measured subsequently at cost less depreciation and impairment. Complete the appropriate tests on the tangible fixed assets programme.</p>', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>7. On initial measurement, the lease liability is measured at the present value of the lease payments that are not paid at that time. </p>\r\n<p>Ensure that this has been calculated appropriately.</p>\r\n<i>See IFRS 16.27 for guidance.</i>', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>8. The discount rate to be used when calculating the present value of the lease payments is either:</p> <ul> <li>The interest rate implicit in the lease, if this rate can be easily determined; or</li> <li>The lessee’s incremental borrowing rate. </li> <li>Periods covered by an option to terminate the lease if the lessee is reasonably certain not to exercise that option.</li> </ul> <p>Obtain appropriate evidence to support the discount rate used. </p> <i>See IFRS 16.26 for detail. </i>', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>9. Where there are changes to the lease payments (for example, as a result of a change in the expected lease term, or a change in the assessment of an option to purchase the underlying asset), ensure that the lease liability is remeasured and a corresponding adjustment to the right of use asset is made.</p>\r\n<i>See IFRS 16.40 to 43 for guidance.</i>', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>10. If there is a lease modification, ensure this is treated as a separate lease only if both qualifying criteria in paragraph 44a have been met.</p>\r\n<p>If the criteria are not met, ensure that the modification has been accounted for correctly.</p>\r\n<i>Refer to IFRS 16.44 to 46 for guidance. </i>', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>11. IFRS 16 is applied using one of the following two methods</p> <p>(a) The “retrospective” method: apply the Standard retrospectively to each prior reporting period presented in accordance with IAS 8 <i>Accounting Policies, Changes in Accounting Estimates and Errors, </i> subject to the expedients in paragraph IFRS 16.C3; or</p> <p>(b) The “cumulative effect” method: retrospectively with the cumulative effect of initially applying IFRS 16 recognised as an adjustment to the opening balance of retained earnings (or other component of equity, as appropriate) of the annual reporting period that includes the date of initial application. </p> <i>The date of initial application is the start of the reporting period in which an entity first applies this Standard (i.e. 1 January 2019 for a 31 December 2019 year-end);</i>', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>12. Ensure that the transition to IFRS 16 has been appropriately dealt with in accordance with Appendix C of IFRS 16.</p>', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>13. Appendix C of IFRS 16 provides a number of practical expedients to lessees who apply the Standard using the cumulative effect method. </p>\r\n<p>Ensure that any practical expedients taken advantage of have been appropriately applied.</p>', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>14. Obtain a reconciliation that shows the impact of first-time adoption of IFRS 16. This should include:</p> <ul> <li>Narrative explanation of how the first-time adoption has been treated (i.e. full retrospective application or the “cumulative effect” approach);</li> <li>Narrative explanation of the changes made on first time adoption; </li> <li> <p><strong>If the retrospective method has been used: </strong></p> <p>For the preceding period, an analysis of each line item in the financial statements affected by the change, showing:</p> <ul> <li>The figure as originally stated under IAS 17;</li> <li>Any reclassification adjustments made;</li> <li>Any remeasurement changes from applying the IFRS 16 requirements;</li> <li>The restated figure under IFRS 16.</li> <li>This should also include a reconciliation of retained earnings.</li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><strong>If the cumulative effect method has been used: </strong></p> <p>For the current period, an analysis of the difference between:</p> <ul> <li>o operating lease commitments disclosed at the prior period end, discounted using the incremental borrowing rate; and</li> <li>o the lease liability recognised on initial application.</li> </ul> </li> </ul> <p>A reconciliation of opening retained earnings should be also be obtained. </p>', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>15. List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>16. Review capital grants received and ensure they have not been netted off the price of the tangible fixed asset acquired. </p>', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>17. Ensure that capital grants received are correctly categorised as government grants and non-government grants.</p>', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>18. Where grants are non-governmental in nature they must be recognised in the profit or loss section of the Statement of Comprehensive Income as soon as the conditions imposed by the grant are satisfied. Ensure this has occurred.</p>\r\n<i>NB: Recognition in income could be as the asset is constructed, when the asset is purchased or over a specific period of time where there are conditions relating to the usage of the asset.</i>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>19. Where grants are governmental they can either be recognised as above or the grant can be credited to deferred income and recognised systematically over the useful economic life of the asset acquired. Ascertain the method used by the client and ensure they have applied this in practice. </p>', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>20. Check whether assets are still being used for the purposes for which the grant was given and consider whether claw-back provisions apply.</p>', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>21. Consider whether capital grants applied for but not received should be treated as accrued income.</p>', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>22. List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>', '', '', '', '2.2.2 C2-1', '2.2.2 C2-1', '16', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:13:36')

params.name: $head =
params.value: Property Plant and Equipment Top Up

post.question:
Array
(
    [0] => <p>1.	The “right of use” model of IFRS 16 does not have to be applied to leases that are short term  <i>(i.e. a lease with a term of 12 months or less from the commencement date). </i></p>
<p>Confirm that any leases for which this exemption has been claimed meet the qualifying criteria.</p>
    [1] => <p>2.	The “right of use” model of IFRS 16 does not have to be applied to leases for which the underlying asset is of low value <i>(refer to IFRS 16 B3 -B8 for guidance).</i></p>
<p>Confirm that any leases for which this exemption has been claimed meet the qualifying criteria.</p>
<p><i>NB: the “low value” criteria is an absolute criteria, based on the underlying asset having a value, when new, of US$5,000 or less. Materiality <strong> <u> does not</u> </strong> come into the equation..</i></p>
    [2] => <p>3.	Ensure that the assessment of the lease term has taken into account each of the following:</p>
<ul>
    <li>The non-cancellable period of the lease;</li>
    <li>•	Periods covered by an option to extend the lease if the lessee is reasonably certain to exercise that option; and</li>
    <li>Periods covered by an option to terminate the lease if the lessee is reasonably certain not to exercise that option.</li>
</ul>
<i>See IFRS 16.B37 - 40 for guidance.</i>
    [3] => <p>4.	Ensure that if the lease term has been revised, this has only happened as a result of a change in the non-cancellable period of the lease.</p>
    [4] => <p>5.	On initial measurement, the right of use asset shall be measured at cost. </p>
<p>Ensure that this has been calculated appropriately.</p>
<i>See IFRS 16.24 for guidance.</i>
    [5] => <p>6.	Generally, the right of use asset will be measured subsequently at cost less depreciation and impairment.  Complete the appropriate tests on the tangible fixed assets programme.</p>
    [6] => <p>7.	On initial measurement, the lease liability is measured at the present value of the lease payments that are not paid at that time. </p>
<p>Ensure that this has been calculated appropriately.</p>
<i>See IFRS 16.27 for guidance.</i>
    [7] => <p>8.	The discount rate to be used when calculating the present value of the lease payments is either:</p>
<ul>
    <li>The interest rate implicit in the lease, if this rate can be easily determined; or</li>
    <li>The lessee’s incremental borrowing rate.  </li>
    <li>Periods covered by an option to terminate the lease if the lessee is reasonably certain not to exercise that option.</li>
</ul>
<p>Obtain appropriate evidence to support the discount rate used. </p>
<i>See IFRS 16.26 for detail. </i>
    [8] => <p>9.	Where there are changes to the lease payments (for example, as a result of a change in the expected lease term, or a change in the assessment of an option to purchase the underlying asset), ensure that the lease liability is remeasured and a corresponding adjustment to the right of use asset is made.</p>
<i>See IFRS 16.40 to 43 for guidance.</i>
    [9] => <p>10.	If there is a lease modification, ensure this is treated as a separate lease only if both qualifying criteria in paragraph 44a have been met.</p>
<p>If the criteria are not met, ensure that the modification has been accounted for correctly.</p>
<i>Refer to IFRS 16.44 to 46 for guidance. </i>
    [10] => <p>11.	IFRS 16 is applied using one of the following two methods</p>
<p>(a)	The “retrospective” method: apply the Standard retrospectively to each prior reporting period presented in accordance with IAS 8 <i>Accounting Policies, Changes in Accounting Estimates and Errors, </i> subject to the expedients in paragraph IFRS 16.C3; or</p>
<p>(b)	The “cumulative effect” method: retrospectively with the cumulative effect of initially applying IFRS 16 recognised as an adjustment to the opening balance of retained earnings (or other component of equity, as appropriate) of the annual reporting period that includes the date of initial application. </p>
<i>The date of initial application is the start of the reporting period in which an entity first applies this Standard (i.e. 1 January 2019 for a 31 December 2019 year-end);</i>
    [11] => <p>12.	Ensure that the transition to IFRS 16 has been appropriately dealt with in accordance with Appendix C of IFRS 16.</p>
    [12] => <p>13.	Appendix C of IFRS 16 provides a number of practical expedients to lessees who apply the Standard using the cumulative effect method. </p>
<p>Ensure that any practical expedients taken advantage of have been appropriately applied.</p>
    [13] => <p>14.	Obtain a reconciliation that shows the impact of first-time adoption of IFRS 16. This should include:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Narrative explanation of how the first-time adoption has been treated (i.e. full retrospective application or the “cumulative effect” approach);</li>
    <li>Narrative explanation of the changes made on first time adoption; </li>
    <li> <p><strong>If the retrospective method has been used: </strong></p>
        <p>For the preceding period, an analysis of each line item in the financial statements affected by the change, showing:</p>
        <ul>
            <li>The figure as originally stated under IAS 17;</li>
            <li>Any reclassification adjustments made;</li>
            <li>Any remeasurement changes from applying the IFRS 16 requirements;</li>
            <li>The restated figure under IFRS 16.</li>
            <li>This should also include a reconciliation of retained earnings.</li>
        </ul>
    </li>
    <li> <p><strong>If the cumulative effect method has been used: </strong></p>
        <p>For the current period, an analysis of the difference between:</p>
        <ul>
            <li>o	operating lease commitments disclosed at the prior period end, discounted using the incremental borrowing rate; and</li>
            <li>o	the lease liability recognised on initial application.</li>
        </ul>
    </li>
</ul>
<p>A reconciliation of opening retained earnings should be also be obtained. </p>
    [14] => <p>15.	List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>
    [15] => <p>16.	Review capital grants received and ensure they have not been netted off the price of the tangible fixed asset acquired.  </p>
    [16] => <p>17.	Ensure that capital grants received are correctly categorised as government grants and non-government grants.</p>
    [17] => <p>18.	Where grants are non-governmental in nature they must be recognised in the profit or loss section of the Statement of Comprehensive Income as soon as the conditions imposed by the grant are satisfied.  Ensure this has occurred.</p>
<i>NB: Recognition in income could be as the asset is constructed, when the asset is purchased or over a specific period of time where there are conditions relating to the usage of the asset.</i>

    [18] => <p>19.	Where grants are governmental they can either be recognised as above or the grant can be credited to deferred income and recognised systematically over the useful economic life of the asset acquired. Ascertain the method used by the client and ensure they have applied this in practice. </p>
    [19] => <p>20.	Check whether assets are still being used for the purposes for which the grant was given and consider whether claw-back provisions apply.</p>
    [20] => <p>21.	Consider whether capital grants applied for but not received should be treated as accrued income.</p>
    [21] => <p>22.	List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>
)
